titleStmt.title: James P. Harbeson to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG6973

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
PHIL. TOMPPERT Jr., CLERK.
FRED. WOBBE, DEPUTY CLERK.
Clerks' Office, Louisville City Court,
Louisville, Ky., Sept 18th 1865 186
His Excellency
Thos. E Bramlette,
Governor State of Kentucky.
Sir,

The fine of $110.00 imposed upon Anne Cooke by a jury in my court for keeping a disorderly house was done after the prooff that, "you could not know it a house of prostitution unless you went into it and not then unless you were known.
I think about half would be nearly right, say $5000.

I am sir with high regard your
obedient Servant
James P Harbeson
Judge L. City Court

Louisville City Ct
vs
Anne Cook
$110.
20 Sept/65
